subject: p15370732
History: -year-old man with abdominal pain and distention.
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. Low lung volumes result in bronchovascular crowding. The left pectoral pacemaker leads end in the expected locations of the right atrium and right ventricle. There is no focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Bibasilar atelectasis is seen. The known FDG-avid nodules seen on recent PET-CT are below the threshold of detection on chest radiograph. Heart size is within normal limits allowing for lung volumes. Mediastinal silhouette and hilar contours are stable. Blunting of the right costophrenic sulcus is similar to , although no effusion is seen on CT.
